author: potuz
content: Having a discussion with a Discord user I realized that perhaps it's a good thing to turn off 40% of nodes on pyrmont. This was meant to be a stress test and mainnet is headed for that order of magnitude of the number of validators. RAM consumption is starting to bite users on the lower end. I think it would be a realistic test of client resource consumption if we let pyrmont not finalize and throw in a couple of random delays to have forks. Modulo de problem that network topology is concentrated, I still would expect an explosion in RAM consumption.

author: jgm
content: I'd rather not have a non-finalizing testnet.  That situation has been tested quite a bit, whereas upcoming tests for hard forks or whatever would be more useful on a chain with a decent history and >= number of nodes on mainnet.

author: potuz
content: It hasn't been tested with >100K validators and in theory it is as easy as turning 40K validators back on to recover. I don't see anything detrimental in such a test
